text: my grandmother was calling from her
assisted living home whenever she wanted
to talk about something really important
she would always say she went on to say
that my aunt was seeing someone my aunt
just had a double hip replacement she
needed help to do everything let alone
date she said he's been in love with her
since kindergarten and he's just been
waiting for my uncle to get out of the
picture
my uncle had committed suicide only
about three months prior to this call my
grandmother had Alzheimer's for seven
years or so we would leave a restaurant
and she would be like the fact that at
this point in her disease she remembered
that my uncle was no longer living was
pretty remarkable he had a name and his
name was Nick Nick Stephanopoulos he was
a wealthy businessman he was gonna take
my aunt to Rome and he was gonna buy her
all these beautiful gifts in the
beginning we were like I think you've
been watching too much television my
grandmother got really upset it was
almost more trouble to deny her this
thing and we were by no means making fun
of her but we kind of talked about him
like he was a family member we just
started playing along
my aunt went to visit her in the
assisted living home she was lying in
her bed and had this really grave look
on her face and she said Nick was on his
way to New Orleans on the train and we
bumped into mr. McDaniel the train
conductor and mr. McDaniel things that
you should know that Nick is involved in
some unscrupulous business deals my aunt
said oh my gosh I will bring that up
with him Nick actually lived for about
two and a half years and my grandmother
her health declined and then one day my
grandmother said I'm sorry to hear about
Nick
I heard he only has three months to live
she knew that she was dying and she had
to kill him off before she left the
world having Nick was sort of this
perfect way to preserve her imagination
and her personality
